name: places/ChIJc2aclPdYwokRwyzmUGEsr-s
adrFormatAddress: 1758 Broadway, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: Great juices but a little on the pricey side. £7 for a juice. It's got a great cube and friendly staff. It's pretty noisy with the hard surfaces and the blenders making it too loud to do a call. That's a major design flaw in my book. The drinks taste great though.

text.text: Great juices but a little on the pricey side. £7 for a juice. It's got a great cube and friendly staff. It's pretty noisy with the hard surfaces and the blenders making it too loud to do a call. That's a major design flaw in my book. The drinks taste great though.

originalText.text: I went here because my co-worker was raving about it. I didn’t try their juice only the viral spicy tuna sandwich… a bit disappointing and the bread was way too crispy and hard. The aesthetics were nice and the box they put your sandwich in is so cute. Their juices are $9 I’m sure it’s healthy and tasty but getting a juice and sandwich is the price of a dinner but not as filling.

originalText.text:
After bike-riding in Central Park, my friends and I wanted to have fresh juice and came to Joe & The Juice. This one is in a great location, just a few minutes from Columbus Circle.

If you’re in a rush, the service was quite slow even though there weren’t many customers in front of us, so I wouldn’t recommend this place.

If you do have the time, they have a small but nice seating space with nice decor, perfect for a coffee or juice break.

I ordered:
- Iron Man - Large ($10.80+) w/strawberry, kiwi and apple
- Butter Croissant ($4.20+)

Not sure why the juices took so long, but the Iron Man was delicious. It was only a $1.80+ difference between the small and large, and I’m glad I ordered the large.

The Butter Croissant was also very tasty, with the perfect texture of flaky layers on the outside and light, airiness on the inside. I generally go to bakeries for a good croissant, but will be back here for more!

originalText.text:
Compared to other juice stores out there, I have to say that this one stands out as one of my personal favorites. The ambiance is fantastic, with a spacious and inviting atmosphere that makes it the perfect spot for catching up with friends or striking up a conversation with a stranger. The background decorations add a touch of charm.

Speaking of the juice itself, it's not the cheapest option out there, but it’s healthy and high quality. I recommend trying out their signature drinks, particularly the Green Mile and Herb Tonic. The Green Mile is a personal favorite of mine, as the addition of avocado lends a smooth, rich texture without any heavy creams or milks. It's a smart choice that really sets this drink apart. Those vegan drinks tend to have lots of calories, I haven’t tried those yet.

One downside to keep in mind is that they do tend to run out of certain vegetables, like cucumber, fairly frequently. However, this is a small price to pay for the excellent selection of juices and smoothies that this store has to offer. Overall, I would definitely recommend giving this juice store a try if you're in the area.

originalText.text: I’ve been seeing this place all over my for you page on my tik tok. That’s it’s the best tunacado they have ever tasted. So I went to taste it and I have to say the bread is so good and soft on the inside & crunchy on the outside. The tuna is perfectly made so not too much or not too little of mayo. The tomatoes and avocados were so fresh. The chocolate croissant will fulfill your sweet tooth. The drink was called pick me up. The atmosphere was very cozy and very beautiful decorated. Perfect place to come to have breakfast.
